name: Vincci Seleccion Estrella del Mar

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for a week early october, we were both pleased with all the hotel facilities. The hotel has an a fairly bland look on the exterior , but inside the design leads to an oasis of calm. The corridors and open spaces are cool and airy. The hotel is convenient to an excellent beach and has its own beach club ,which we did not visit but looks impressive. We walked to one restaurant locally which was fine, other nights we drove to la calla , cabopina, or calahonda ,all of which have a choice of good restaurants. The hotel has 3 swimming pools and a children's pool, all in all a place I would re visit with pleasure.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband took me to this hotel last week for my birthday gift. We received a warm welcome and a drink on arrival at the hotel while checking in, we were bed & breakfast basis. Breakfast choice & quality is fantastic! Beautiful hotel, lovely room and fab bathroom with lovely big fast filling bath, lovely pools, plenty of sunbeds, everything spotlessly clean and very friendly staff; we were especially well looked after by Vicente in the Lobby Bar most evenings. Thank you to a recent Trip Advisor review which mentioned taking a travel kettle - we did! We ate in Baraka only once, then ate out each night and especially enjoyed the Beach House & Banderas restaurants - both easy walking distance near beach. We also found a lovely modern newly reopened & refurbished pub just down the hill, La Higuera, and were made extremely welcome by Christina and the world's smallest guard dog "Dolphin" on each visit and their Goulash was fab too.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didnt use the Hotel Spa - the complimentary day ticket we received could only be used on our first or second day when we had other plans. Because of the price and knowing we wouldnt make full use of the spa facilities, we gave it a miss. The two days we spent on the very clean beach we paid for normal beach sunbeds and had a most relaxing time, despite many vendors.
reviews.title: pleasant stay

reviews.title: Very quiet stay
Clean and tranquil
reviews.text: Our room, located on ground floor, was noisy at the weekend, hearing latecomers coming back in. We we were also wakened by our neighbours' walking on the marble floors in early morning, worse when heels were worn.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent three days at this hotel. It was absolutely beautiful. There are pools at the resort but nothing compares to the few minute walk down to the beach club and the Mediterranean beach waiting for you. For a few euros, you can rent chairs and the bar staff will come out and take your order. We were fortunate enough to arrive a little later in the afternoon and not incur the chair charge. Be aware the Spanish sun can still be strong as we got sun as late as 3:30 in the afternoon. There are sofas lined up outside the beach club where you can relax with a drink and appetizers and watch the sunset over the sea. The rooms are good sized and well appointed. The staff is extremely helpful and everything is very clean. I would absolutely stay here again.
reviews.title: Definitely "Star of the Sea"

reviews.text: Even though this is not right on the beach and the location is not the best in the world, the hotel does have a fantastic pool and lawn. The rooms are fantastic with a jacuzzi, king size bed and and very elegant. The room also had an exit directly to the garden. The gym was also decent and the breakfast very good.
reviews.title: Modern Touch with a great atmosphere

reviews.text: Just returned from our 2nd visit to the Vincci. Can't rate it highly enough, excellent staff, nothing is too much trouble, fantastic breakfasts, luxurious room with huge marble bathroom.
reviews.title: Lovely 2nd visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel last week and from the moment we walked in the door we were treated with respect and as a valued customer.The room was a good size and very clean and had a great bathroom, the only down side to the room was that there wasn't a kettle in the room. We opted for a superior room and we are glad we did as you seem to get a better sized room with a good sized bed and in the main building which we liked.
reviews.title: Interesting experience?

reviews.text: Had a very good time in this hotel with a friend: attentive staff, good food (multiple choice) and location. You will need a car if you want to go around, to Marbella or to other cities in Andalucia.
reviews.title: Perfect for girl break

reviews.text: The resort is a bit difficult to find at first if you come by car: the main road is long, you have to get used to the exits for direction changes and then try not to miss the exit!
reviews.title: This hotel COULD be a 5*...

reviews.text: Will definitely return, though.
reviews.title: Last little bit of sun

reviews.text: Just back from a week here. I agree with a lot of other reviewers that this lovely hotel tries hard but it's not really 5*. The fact is that the staff are so smiley and adorable that you feel bad pointing out stuff that just doesn't quite cut it. The front desk staff are excellent. Helpful, young and charming. The breakfast buffet is good - the charming Pinuccia stands out. The buffet dinner however is not quite up to the job. Barak is a good restaurant but lacks atmosphere. I would drop the miserable Rachmaninoff and play a bit of uplifting New York Piano bar stuff or Ella Fitzgerald or something chilled (same at breakfast - I LOVE Rachmaninoff but not with my bacon and eggs - both of which were very good by the way!) I also have to agree that attention to detail was missing and yes, the fabulous pool areas were marred because they felt a bit grubby - Geronimo the barman was a delight so once again you tended to overlook the detail. The hanging space in the wardrobes are too short for dresses. The lovely bath was too short to lie in. Glasses and plates were left in the room without being cleared. You see, I feel dis-loyal even saying this but it's all justifiable. I love this hotel, I want to go back but I also want to rectify the niggles. The main thing that put guests' back up (I heard a lot of talk about it) was the E35 charge, per person, per day to use the beach club - just cheap and how maddening is it to have to walk all around the perimeter of the hotel to get to the beach. Why not put a gate (activated by a room swipe key and closed at night for security?) in the corner of the gardens closest to the beach? There is the sweetest young man to run you down there but this is a hotel design fault. I also agree that there is a divine veranda area with stylish sofas and comfy chairs and also nice tables and chairs on the lawn but the bar staff aren't really well enough trained, plus once again, I agree, it would be simple to offer some good, upmarket bar food. The bar menus are grubby and sticky and need a re-think. I loved being at this hotel and will go back by which time I hope that the constructive criticism will have been taken on board by the management.
reviews.title: Building not 5-star, but staff and cleanliness are!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just come back from a long weekend stay at the hotel with my husband and 19 year old daughter. The room was one of the best we have stayed in. The only disappointing aspect with the room was that there were no tea and coffee facilities. After a busy day sightseeing we would have loved to sit outside in the private garden area with a cup of coffee.
reviews.title: End of Summer Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach club is clearly over priced. 35€ to sit on a sunbed on the beach - which were particularly uncomfortable - is way too much! Even with an infinity pool and an interior pool/spa it is not worth it. We went there once and never did it again. The 3 pools at the hotel are great and free!
reviews.title: table at end of bed

aka: Vincci Seleccion Estrella Del Mar Hotel Marbella
description: Vincci Selección Estrella del Mar 5* is a Luxury 5-Star establishment belonging to the Vincci Hoteles chain. The Vincci Selección Estrella del Mar is located in Marbella, 8 km from downtown and 43 km from Malaga airport. The hotel is set in an exceptional location in the heart of the Costa del Sol, in the area known as “Elviria–Las Chapas”, regarded as one of the town's most desirable spots and near what is considered the best beach on this part of the coast.Built in a modern Mediterranean style with Arab influence, it has 137 rooms and suites, all imbued with Vincci Hoteles trademark style and elegance.
